article:
Chandramukhi 2

Chandramukhi 2 is an upcoming Indian Tamil-language comedy horror film written and directed by P. Vasu. The film is a sequel to the 2005 film Chandramukhi, which was also directed by Vasu. The film stars Raghava Lawrence, Kangana Ranaut, and Vadivelu in the lead roles.

# Plot

The plot of Chandramukhi 2 revolves around a young man named Raghuraman (Raghava Lawrence), who is haunted by a vengeful spirit named Chandramukhi. The story begins with Raghuraman, a successful businessman, who is happily married to his wife Priya (Kangana Ranaut). However, their happiness is short-lived, as Raghuraman starts experiencing strange and terrifying events. He soon discovers that he is being haunted by Chandramukhi, a spirit who was wronged by his ancestors.

As the haunting intensifies, Raghuraman seeks the help of a psychiatrist, who diagnoses him with a rare psychological disorder. However, Raghuraman is convinced that he is being haunted by a real spirit. Desperate for help, he turns to a local sorcerer, who claims to have the power to exorcise the spirit.

Meanwhile, Priya starts experiencing strange occurrences, which she initially dismisses as hallucinations. However, as the events escalate, she starts to suspect that something supernatural is at play. Together, Raghuraman and Priya embark on a journey to uncover the truth behind Chandramukhi's haunting.

As they delve deeper into the mystery, they discover that Chandramukhi was a princess who was wronged by Raghuraman's ancestors. The spirit is seeking revenge for the injustices she suffered, and Raghuraman is the chosen target.

The film takes a series of twists and turns, as Raghuraman and Priya try to outsmart the spirit and find a way to exorcise her. Along the way, they are aided by a comic relief, played by Vadivelu, who provides much-needed comic relief in the film.

# Cast

* Raghava Lawrence as Raghuraman
* Kangana Ranaut as Priya
* Vadivelu as a sorcerer
* Lakshmi Menon as Chandramukhi
* Soori as a psychiatrist
* Manobala as a friend of Raghuraman

# Production

## Development

The development of Chandramukhi 2 began in 2018, when director P. Vasu announced plans to make a sequel to the 2005 film Chandramukhi. The film was initially titled Chandramukhi 2: The Return, but was later shortened to Chandramukhi 2.

## Casting

The casting process for Chandramukhi 2 began in 2019, when Raghava Lawrence was signed to play the lead role of Raghuraman. Kangana Ranaut was later signed to play the role of Priya, while Vadivelu was cast in a comic relief role.

## Filming

Principal photography for Chandramukhi 2 began in January 2020, in Chennai. The film was shot on a budget of ₹50 crore, and was expected to be completed within six months. However, the filming was delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and was eventually completed in August 2022.

## Post-production

The post-production work for Chandramukhi 2 began in September 2022, and was completed in November 2022. The film's editing was handled by Suresh Urs, while the music was composed by Vidyasagar.

# Music

The music for Chandramukhi 2 was composed by Vidyasagar, who also composed the music for the original film. The soundtrack features six tracks, including the title song "Chandramukhi 2", which was released in November 2022.

# Release

## Release

Chandramukhi 2 is scheduled to be released in theaters on December 15, 2023. The film will be released in Tamil, Telugu, and Hindi languages.

## Home media

The home media rights for Chandramukhi 2 have been acquired by Amazon Prime Video. The film will be available to stream on the platform after its theatrical release.

# Reception

## Box office

Chandramukhi 2 is expected to perform well at the box office, given the success of the original film. The film's trailer has received over 10 million views on YouTube, and the film's music has been well-received by fans.

## Critical response

The critical response to Chandramukhi 2 has been positive, with many critics praising the film's storyline and performances. The film has been rated 4/5 stars by several critics, who have praised the film's horror elements and comic relief.

# Notes

* Chandramukhi 2 is the first film in the Chandramukhi franchise to feature Raghava Lawrence in the lead role.
* The film's title song "Chandramukhi 2" was released on November 15, 2022.
* The film's trailer was released on November 20, 2022.

article:
Qatar Corruption Scandal at the European Parliament

The Qatar corruption scandal at the European Parliament refers to a major corruption scandal that erupted in December 2022, involving allegations of bribery and influence peddling by Qatar and other countries within the European Parliament. The scandal led to the arrest of several high-ranking officials, including a vice-president of the European Parliament, and sparked widespread outrage and calls for greater transparency and accountability within the institution.

# Allegations and events leading up to the arrests

In the months leading up to the arrests, there were growing concerns about the influence of foreign powers within the European Parliament. In particular, Qatar had been accused of attempting to exert undue influence over European politicians in order to advance its own interests. In July 2022, the European Parliament's main center-right group, the European People's Party, called for an investigation into allegations of corruption and undue influence by Qatar.

In November 2022, the European Parliament's Committee on Foreign Affairs (AFET) voted to adopt a resolution criticizing Qatar's human rights record and calling for greater transparency and accountability in the country's dealings with the European Union. The resolution was seen as a significant rebuke to Qatar, which had been attempting to improve its image in Europe through a series of high-profile lobbying efforts.

# Investigation, raids and arrests

On December 9, 2022, Belgian police launched a series of raids on the homes and offices of several high-ranking officials within the European Parliament. The raids were part of a broader investigation into allegations of corruption and influence peddling by Qatar and other countries.

Four people were arrested during the raids, including Eva Kaili, a Greek MEP and vice-president of the European Parliament. Kaili was one of the most senior officials to be arrested, and her detention sent shockwaves through the European Parliament.

In addition to Kaili, three other people were arrested: Francesco Giorgi, an Italian national who worked as a parliamentary assistant; Luca Visentini, an Italian national who was the general secretary of the International Trade Union Confederation (ITUC); and Antonio Panzeri, an Italian MEP who was a member of the European Parliament's Committee on Foreign Affairs.

# Connections with Morocco

In addition to Qatar, there were also allegations of corruption and influence peddling by Morocco within the European Parliament. Panzeri, one of the arrested MEPs, was accused of having close ties to the Moroccan government and of having accepted bribes from Moroccan officials in exchange for promoting the country's interests within the European Parliament.

The allegations of corruption and influence peddling by Morocco were seen as part of a broader pattern of behavior by the country, which had been accused of attempting to exert undue influence over European politicians in order to advance its own interests.

# Connections with Mauritania

There were also allegations of corruption and influence peddling by Mauritania within the European Parliament. Niccolò Figà-Talamanca, an Italian national who worked as a parliamentary assistant, was accused of having close ties to the Mauritanian government and of having accepted bribes from Mauritanian officials in exchange for promoting the country's interests within the European Parliament.

# Trial and prosecution

The trial of the arrested officials began in January 2023. Kaili, Giorgi, Visentini, and Panzeri all denied the allegations against them and maintained their innocence.

The prosecution presented a significant amount of evidence, including documents and witness testimony, which suggested that the defendants had accepted bribes from Qatari and Moroccan officials in exchange for promoting the countries' interests within the European Parliament.

# Reactions

## Political

The reaction to the scandal was swift and severe. The European Parliament's president, Roberta Metsola, condemned the allegations and called for greater transparency and accountability within the institution.

The leaders of the European Parliament's main political groups also condemned the allegations and called for a thorough investigation. The European People's Party, the Socialists and Democrats, and the Renew Europe group all issued statements condemning the allegations and calling for greater transparency and accountability.

## Civil society

Civil society organizations also reacted strongly to the scandal. Transparency International, a leading anti-corruption organization, called for a thorough investigation and greater transparency and accountability within the European Parliament.

## Government of Qatar

The government of Qatar denied any wrongdoing and maintained that it had not engaged in any corrupt or improper activities within the European Parliament.

## Defendants

### Eva Kaili

Kaili denied the allegations against her and maintained her innocence. She claimed that she had been the victim of a "set-up" and that the allegations against her were part of a broader conspiracy to discredit her.

### Francesco Giorgi

Giorgi also denied the allegations against him and maintained his innocence. He claimed that he had been a victim of circumstance and that the allegations against him were part of a broader pattern of behavior by the European Parliament's authorities.

### Luca Visentini

Visentini denied the allegations against him and maintained his innocence. He claimed that he had been a victim of a "witch-hunt" and that the allegations against him were part of a broader conspiracy to discredit him.

### Antonio Panzeri

Panzeri denied the allegations against him and maintained his innocence. He claimed that he had been a victim of circumstance and that the allegations against him were part of a broader pattern of behavior by the European Parliament's authorities.

### Niccolò Figà-Talamanca

Figà-Talamanca denied the allegations against him and maintained his innocence. He claimed that he had been a victim of a "set-up" and that the allegations against him were part of a broader conspiracy to discredit him.

### Marc Tarabella

Tarabella, a Belgian MEP who was accused of having close ties to the Qatari government, denied the allegations against him and maintained his innocence.

### Andrea Cozzolino

Cozzolino, an Italian MEP who was accused of having close ties to the Qatari government, denied the allegations against him and maintained his innocence.

# Post-scandal changes

The scandal led to a number of significant changes within the European Parliament. The institution's president, Roberta Metsola, announced a series of reforms aimed at increasing transparency and accountability.

The European Parliament also established a new ethics committee, which was tasked with investigating allegations of corruption and undue influence within the institution.

2022 French Open – Men's singles

The men's singles competition at the 2022 French Open took place from May 22 to June 5, 2022, at the Stade Roland-Garros in Paris, France. The tournament was the 121st edition of the French Open and the second Grand Slam event of the year. Rafael Nadal was the defending champion, having won the title in 2021.

# Seeds

The seeds for the men's singles competition were announced on May 19, 2022. The top eight seeds were:

1. Novak Djokovic (Serbia)
2. Daniil Medvedev (Russia)
3. Stefanos Tsitsipas (Greece)

The draw for the men's singles competition took place on May 19, 2022. The competition began with 128 players competing in a single-elimination tournament. Players were seeded based on their world ranking, with the top 32 seeds receiving a bye in the first round.

Rublev then defeated Jannik Sinner in the fourth round, also in four sets.

article:
Bigg Boss (Telugu TV series) season 7

Bigg Boss Telugu season 7 is the seventh season of the Telugu-language version of the Indian reality television series Bigg Boss. The show premiered on 3 September 2023 and is being broadcast on Star Maa. The show is hosted by Nagarjuna.

# Production

## Eye Logo

The eye logo for the seventh season was unveiled on 13 August 2023. The logo features a stylized eye with a mix of traditional and modern elements, symbolizing the theme of the season, "Dosthi".

## Teasers

The first teaser for the season was released on 23 August 2023, featuring Nagarjuna as the host. The teaser hinted at the theme of the season, showcasing friends turning against each other.

## Concept

The concept of the season is "Dosthi", which translates to "friendship" in Telugu. The season focuses on the relationships between friends and how they change over time.

## 24x7 streaming

The show is available for 24x7 streaming on the Disney+ Hotstar platform.

## Voting process

Viewers can vote for their favorite contestants through the Disney+ Hotstar app or by giving a missed call to the numbers assigned to each contestant.

# Housemates status

The housemates are divided into two groups: "Dosthulu" (Friends) and "Betrayer". The contestants are initially divided into the "Dosthulu" group, but as the season progresses, some contestants are labeled as "Betrayer" for their actions in the house.

# Housemates

## Original entrants

The original entrants of the season were announced on 3 September 2023. The contestants include:

* Aishwarya B.

## Money offer

In week 4, Bigg Boss offered a cash prize of ₹25 lakh to the contestants, but with a twist. The contestants had to bid on the amount they were willing to give up from their prize money to win the cash prize.

## Power astra

In week 5, Bigg Boss introduced the "Power Astra" concept, where the contestants had to compete in tasks to win the power to save themselves from nomination.

## Bedroom allotment

In week 6, Bigg Boss introduced a twist in the bedroom allotment, where the contestants had to share their bedrooms with the contestants they had nominated for eviction.

## Bigg Boss 2.0 launch

On 16 September 2023, Bigg Boss launched the 2.0 version of the show, which introduced new twists and challenges for the contestants.

In week 7, Bigg Boss introduced special powers for the contestants, where the Head of the House (HOL), the Boss of the House (HOB), and the King of the House (HOK) had special privileges and responsibilities.

## Mutual funds

In week 8, Bigg Boss introduced the concept of mutual funds, where the contestants had to invest in each other's funds to win prizes and immunity from nomination.

* Samantha Ruth Prabhu

article:
Naagin (2015 TV series)
======================

Naagin is an Indian supernatural drama television series produced by Ekta Kapoor and Shobha Kapoor under the banner of Balaji Telefilms. The series premiered on 1 November 2015 on Colors TV and ran for six seasons until its conclusion on 9 August 2020.

Series overview
---------------

Naagin is a fantasy drama that revolves around the story of a shape-shifting snake woman, referred to as a Naagin, who seeks revenge against those who have wronged her and her family. The series explores themes of love, betrayal, and revenge, with a mix of supernatural elements and melodrama.

Plot
-----

### Season 1

The first season of Naagin premiered on 1 November 2015 and introduced the main protagonist, Shivanya (played by Mouni Roy), a Naagin who seeks revenge against the evil plans of the evil-minded human, Ankush Raheja (played by Manish Khanna). Shivanya's primary goal is to avenge her parents' death and restore her family's honor. The season also featured Arjun Bijlani as Ritik Singh, Shivanya's love interest.

### Season 2

The second season of Naagin premiered on 8 October 2016 and introduced a new lead character, Shivangi (played by Mouni Roy), who seeks revenge against the evil plans of the evil-minded human, Yamini (played by Sudha Chandran). The season also featured Karishma Tanna as Avni, a shape-shifting eagle, and Adaa Khan as Shesha, a shape-shifting snake.

### Season 3

The third season of Naagin premiered on 2 June 2018 and introduced a new lead character, Bela (played by Surbhi Jyoti), a Naagin who seeks revenge against the evil plans of the evil-minded human, Mahir Sehgal (played by Pearl V Puri). The season also featured Anita Hassanandani as Vishaka, a shape-shifting snake.

### Season 4

The fourth season of Naagin premiered on 14 December 2019 and introduced a new lead character, Brinda (played by Nia Sharma), a Naagin who seeks revenge against the evil plans of the evil-minded human, Dev Parikh (played by Vijayendra Kumeria). The season also featured Rashami Desai as Shalaka, a shape-shifting snake.

### Season 5

The fifth season of Naagin premiered on 9 August 2020 and introduced a new lead character, Bani (played by Surbhi Chandna), a Naagin who seeks revenge against the evil plans of the evil-minded human, Jay Mathur (played by Mohit Sehgal). The season also featured Sharad Malhotra as Veeranshu Singhania, Bani's love interest.

### Basant Panchami Special

A special episode, Basant Panchami Special, aired on 29 January 2020, which featured a crossover between Naagin 4 and other Colors TV shows.

### Season 6

The sixth season of Naagin premiered on 12 February 2022 and introduced a new lead character, Pratha (played by Tejasswi Prakash), a Naagin who seeks revenge against the evil plans of the evil-minded human, Rishabh Gujral (played by Simba Nagpal). The season also featured Meheck Chahal as Mahek, a shape-shifting snake.

Cast
-----

### Recurring

#### Season 1

* Mouni Roy as Shivanya Ritik Singh
* Arjun Bijlani as Ritik Singh
* Adaa Khan as Shesha
* Sudha Chandran as Yamini Singh Rathod

* Mahek Chahal as Sakshi

### Guest

#### Season 2

Crossover
----------

Naagin had several crossover episodes with other Colors TV shows, including:

* Basant Panchami Special (2020) - a crossover between Naagin 4 and other Colors TV shows.
* Shakti - Astitva Ke Ehsaas Ki (2016) - a crossover between Naagin 2 and Shakti - Astitva Ke Ehsaas Ki.
* Sasural Simar Ka (2016) - a crossover between Naagin 2 and Sasural Simar Ka.
* Udaan (2017) - a crossover between Naagin 2 and Udaan.

Spin-offs
----------

Naagin had several spin-offs, including:

* Naagin - Bhagya Ka Zehreela Khel (2019) - a spin-off of Naagin 3.
* Naagin - Ek Anjaan Kahani (2020) - a spin-off of Naagin 4.

Reception
----------

### Rating

#### Season 2

* The season premiere of Naagin 2 received a rating of 4.9 million impressions.
* The season finale of Naagin 2 received a rating of 4.4 million impressions.

#### Season 3

* The season premiere of Naagin 3 received a rating of 3.6 million impressions.
* The season finale of Naagin 3 received a rating of 3.3 million impressions.

#### Season 4

* The season finale of Naagin 5 received a rating of 2.2 million impressions.

#### Season 6

* The season finale of Naagin 6 received a rating of 1.9 million impressions.

Soundtrack
------------

The soundtrack of Naagin was composed by Sanjeev Srivastava and released on 1 November 2015. The soundtrack features several songs, including "Naagin" and "Ritik-Shivanya".

Awards and nominations
----------------------

Naagin won several awards, including:

article:
Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 is a 2022 Indian Hindi-language comedy horror film directed by Anees Bazmee and produced by Bhushan Kumar and Krishan Kumar under the banner of T-Series Films. The film is a standalone sequel to the 2007 film Bhool Bhulaiyaa and stars Kartik Aaryan, Kiara Advani, and Tabu in the lead roles.

# Plot

The film follows the story of Ruhan Randhawa (Kartik Aaryan), a charming and carefree tourist who meets Reet Thakur (Kiara Advani) on a flight. They fall in love, and Reet invites Ruhan to her hometown, Bhawanigarh, to meet her family. However, things take a turn when Ruhan discovers that Reet's family is hiding a dark secret. The family's ancestral mansion is believed to be haunted by the ghost of Manjulika, a former owner of the mansion who died under mysterious circumstances.

As Ruhan tries to uncover the truth behind the haunting, he becomes embroiled in a series of supernatural events and hilarious misunderstandings. Along the way, he seeks the help of a fake exorcist, Batuk Shankar Tripathi (Sanjay Mishra), who claims to have the power to communicate with spirits.

As the story unfolds, Ruhan discovers that the real reason behind the haunting is not the ghost of Manjulika but a dark family secret that has been hidden for years. The film's climax features a thrilling confrontation between Ruhan and the true culprit behind the haunting.

# Cast

* Kartik Aaryan as Ruhan Randhawa
* Kiara Advani as Reet Thakur
* Tabu as Anjali Thakur
* Sanjay Mishra as Batuk Shankar Tripathi
* Rajpal Yadav as Chhote Pandit
* Amar Upadhyay as Dev Raj Thakur
* Milind Gunaji as Thakur Sahab
* Kishore Kadam as Babu Rao
* Ashwini Kalsekar as Laxmi

# Production

## Development

The film was first announced in 2019, with Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani attached to star in the lead roles. Anees Bazmee was roped in to direct the film, which was initially titled "Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3". However, the title was later changed to "Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2" to avoid confusion with the original film.

## Filming

Principal photography for the film began in October 2020 in Mumbai and Jaipur. The film's shoot was delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic, but the cast and crew resumed filming in January 2021. The film's director, Anees Bazmee, had to work with a limited crew and follow strict safety protocols to ensure the safety of the cast and crew.

# Release

## Theatrical

Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 was released theatrically on May 20, 2022, in India and worldwide. The film received a wide release, with over 3,000 screens in India and over 1,000 screens overseas.

## Home media

The film's digital rights were acquired by Netflix, and it was made available to stream on the platform from June 19, 2022. The film's satellite rights were sold to Sony Entertainment Television.

# Soundtrack

The film's soundtrack was composed by Pritam, with lyrics by Sameer, Shabbir Ahmed, and Badshah. The soundtrack features six tracks, including the popular song "De Taali". The soundtrack received positive reviews from music critics, with many praising the film's background score.

# Reception

## Critical response

Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 received mixed reviews from critics, with many praising the film's performances, music, and direction. However, some critics felt that the film's storyline was predictable and lacked originality. The film holds a rating of 4.5/5 on IMDB and 2.5/5 on Bollywood Hungama.

## Box office

Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 was a commercial success, grossing over ₹250 crore (US$31 million) worldwide. The film became the highest-grossing film of 2022 in India, surpassing other big-budget films like "RRR" and "KGF: Chapter 2".

# Sequel

A sequel to Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 has been announced, with Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani set to reprise their roles. The film's director, Anees Bazmee, has confirmed that the sequel will be a standalone film and will not follow the same storyline as the original.

2023 FIVB Volleyball Women's Olympic Qualification Tournaments

The 2023 FIVB Volleyball Women's Olympic Qualification Tournaments were a series of volleyball tournaments held from September 16 to October 1, 2023, to determine the final six teams to qualify for the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, France. A total of 24 teams competed in the qualification process, with 18 teams participating in the intercontinental qualification tournaments and six teams competing in the continental qualification tournaments.

# Hosts selection

The FIVB announced the hosts for the intercontinental qualification tournaments on March 22, 2023. China, Japan, and Poland were selected to host the three tournaments, with each tournament featuring eight teams. The host teams were guaranteed a spot in their respective tournaments.

# Qualification

The qualification process for the 2024 Summer Olympics began in August 2022, with the FIVB releasing the qualification criteria and schedule. The top 12 teams from the FIVB Volleyball Women's Nations League 2022, as well as the top two teams from each of the five continental confederations, qualified for the intercontinental qualification tournaments. The remaining teams competed in the continental qualification tournaments to determine the final two spots.

# Pools composition

The 18 teams participating in the intercontinental qualification tournaments were divided into three pools of six teams each. The teams were seeded based on their FIVB World Ranking, with the top six teams seeded into separate pools. The remaining teams were drawn into the pools, with the teams from the same continental confederation separated whenever possible.

# Venues

The three intercontinental qualification tournaments were held in Ningbo, China; Tokyo, Japan; and Łódź, Poland. The Ningbo tournament was held at the Ningbo Beilun Gymnasium, while the Tokyo tournament was held at the Tokyo Metropolitan Gymnasium. The Łódź tournament was held at the Atlas Arena.

# Pool standing procedure

The teams in each pool played a round-robin format, with each team playing five matches. The teams were ranked based on the number of wins, with the winner of each match receiving three points. In the event of a tie, the teams were separated based on the number of sets won, followed by the number of points won.

# Squads

The 2023 IIHF World Championship was the 87th edition of the IIHF World Championship, an annual international ice hockey tournament organized by the International Ice Hockey Federation (IIHF). The tournament took place from May 12 to May 28, 2023, in Finland and Latvia.

# Host nation bid

The hosting rights for the 2023 IIHF World Championship were awarded to Finland and Latvia on May 19, 2017, at the IIHF Annual Congress in Cologne, Germany. The two countries submitted a joint bid, which was chosen over a bid from Slovakia.

# Venues

2022 North Indian Ocean cyclone season

The 2022 North Indian Ocean cyclone season was a season that produced 19 tropical cyclones, of which 6 intensified into cyclonic storms. The season officially began on April 1, 2022, and ended on December 31, 2022. This season was part of the larger Indian Ocean Dipole (IOD), which is a complex weather pattern that affects the climate of the Indian Ocean region.

# Season summary

During the season, the North Indian Ocean experienced a total of 19 depressions, with 6 of them strengthening into cyclonic storms. The season was marked by a slightly above-average number of cyclones, with the majority of them forming in the Bay of Bengal. The season's first cyclone, Deep Depression BOB 01, formed on March 20, 2022, while the last cyclone, Depression BOB 10, dissipated on December 20, 2022. The strongest cyclone of the season was Severe Cyclonic Storm Asani, which reached peak winds of 120 km/h (75 mph) on May 10, 2022.

Deep Depression BOB 01 formed on March 20, 2022, in the Bay of Bengal, about 500 km (310 mi) southeast of Visakhapatnam, India. The system moved north-northwestwards and intensified into a deep depression, with maximum sustained winds of 55 km/h (35 mph). The depression made landfall on March 22, 2022, in the Andhra Pradesh coast, bringing light to moderate rainfall to the region. The system dissipated on March 24, 2022.

article:
2022 Winter Olympics

The 2022 Winter Olympics, officially known as the XXIV Olympic Winter Games, were an international multi-sport event held in Beijing, China, from February 4 to 20, 2022. This marked the first time that China hosted the Winter Olympics, and the second time that Beijing hosted the Olympics, after the 2008 Summer Olympics.

# Bidding process

The bidding process for the 2022 Winter Olympics began in 2013, with six cities initially expressing interest in hosting the Games: Almaty, Kazakhstan; Beijing, China; Krakow, Poland; Lviv, Ukraine; Oslo, Norway; and Stockholm, Sweden. However, Krakow, Lviv, Oslo, and Stockholm withdrew their bids, leaving Almaty and Beijing as the final two candidates. On July 31, 2015, the International Olympic Committee (IOC) announced that Beijing had won the bid to host the 2022 Winter Olympics, defeating Almaty by a vote of 44-40.

# Development and preparations

## Venues

The 2022 Winter Olympics featured 25 venues, including 13 new venues and 12 existing venues. The venues were divided into three zones: Beijing, Yanqing, and Zhangjiakou.

### Beijing Zone

The Beijing Zone featured 13 venues, including the Beijing National Stadium, which hosted the opening and closing ceremonies. Other venues in the Beijing Zone included the Capital Indoor Stadium, the Beijing National Aquatics Center, and the National Speed Skating Oval.

### Zhangjiakou Zone

The Zhangjiakou Zone featured four venues, including the Genting Snow Park, the Taiwu Ski Resort, and the Kuyangshu Nordic Center and Biathlon Center. The Zhangjiakou Zone was located approximately 160 km northwest of Beijing.

## Medals

The medals for the 2022 Winter Olympics were designed by Hangzhou-based artist Hang Yihong and features a combination of traditional Chinese and modern elements. The medals were made of gold, silver, and bronze, with a diameter of 85.6 mm and a thickness of 5.2 mm.

## Torch relay

The torch relay for the 2022 Winter Olympics began on October 18, 2021, in Olympia, Greece, and ended on February 4, 2022, at the opening ceremony in Beijing. The torch relay featured 1,200 torchbearers and covered a distance of approximately 60,000 km.

## Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic

The COVID-19 pandemic had a significant impact on the 2022 Winter Olympics, with the IOC and the Chinese government implementing a range of measures to prevent the spread of the virus. These measures included requiring athletes and officials to be vaccinated, conducting regular COVID-19 tests, and enforcing social distancing measures.

## Transportation

The 2022 Winter Olympics featured a range of transportation options for athletes, officials, and spectators, including high-speed trains, buses, and taxis. The Beijing Daxing International Airport was the main airport for the Games, with a capacity to handle 75 million passengers per year.

## Budget

The budget for the 2022 Winter Olympics was approximately $3.5 billion, which was significantly lower than the original estimate of $6.5 billion. The budget was reduced due to a number of factors, including the reuse of venues from the 2008 Summer Olympics and the implementation of cost-saving measures.

# Ceremonies

## Opening ceremony

The opening ceremony for the 2022 Winter Olympics was held on February 4, 2022, at the Beijing National Stadium. The ceremony featured a range of performances and events, including the lighting of the Olympic cauldron and the parade of nations.

## Closing ceremony

The closing ceremony for the 2022 Winter Olympics was held on February 20, 2022, at the Beijing National Stadium. The ceremony featured a range of performances and events, including the extinguishing of the Olympic cauldron and the parade of nations.

# Sports

The 2022 Winter Olympics featured 109 events in 15 sports, including alpine skiing, biathlon, bobsleigh, cross-country skiing, curling, figure skating, freestyle skiing, ice dance, ice hockey, luge, Nordic combined, short track speed skating, skeleton, ski jumping, and snowboarding.

## New events

# Participating National Olympic Committees

# Medal table

## Podium sweeps

There were two podium sweeps at the 2022 Winter Olympics, with Norway sweeping the medals in the men's cross-country skiing 30 km mass start and Germany sweeping the medals in the two-man bobsleigh.

## Changes in medal standings

There were several changes in the medal standings during the 2022 Winter Olympics, with the most notable being the disqualification of the Russian mixed doubles curling team for doping.

# Marketing

## Emblem

The emblem for the 2022 Winter Olympics was designed by Chinese artist Lin Cunzhen and features a stylized image of a skier and a snowboarder. The emblem was unveiled on December 15, 2017.

## Mascot

The mascot for the 2022 Winter Olympics was a giant panda named Bing Dwen Dwen. The mascot was designed by Chinese artist Cao Xue and was unveiled on September 17, 2019.

## Slogan

The slogan for the 2022 Winter Olympics was "Together for a Shared Future".

# Viewership

The 2022 Winter Olympics were broadcast in over 200 countries and territories, with a global audience of over 2 billion people.

# Broadcasting

The 2022 Winter Olympics were broadcast by a range of networks, including NBCUniversal in the United States, CBC/Radio-Canada in Canada, and CCTV in China.

# Concerns and controversies

## American diplomatic boycott

The United States announced a diplomatic boycott of the 2022 Winter Olympics on December 6, 2021, citing concerns over human rights in China. Several other countries, including Australia, Canada, and the United Kingdom, also announced diplomatic boycotts.

### Key event timeline

2022 Crimean Bridge Explosion

The 2022 Crimean Bridge explosion was a major incident that occurred on October 8, 2022, when a significant explosion damaged the Crimean Bridge, a critical transportation artery connecting the Russian mainland to the Crimean Peninsula. The bridge, which spans the Kerch Strait, was a vital supply route for Russian forces in Ukraine and a symbol of Russia's annexation of Crimea in 2014.

#Background

The Crimean Bridge, also known as the Kerch Strait Bridge, was opened in 2018 by Russian President Vladimir Putin. The 19-kilometer-long bridge was constructed at a cost of over $3.6 billion and was designed to facilitate the transportation of goods and people between the Russian mainland and the Crimean Peninsula. The bridge was also seen as a strategic move by Russia to solidify its control over Crimea, which was annexed in 2014 following a disputed referendum.

In the years leading up to the explosion, the Crimean Bridge had become a critical supply route for Russian forces in Ukraine, particularly during the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine. The bridge was used to transport troops, equipment, and supplies to Russian forces in southern Ukraine.

#Event

On October 8, 2022, at around 6:00 a.m. local time, a massive explosion occurred on the Crimean Bridge. The explosion, which was reportedly caused by a truck bomb, damaged a significant portion of the bridge's roadway and caused a massive fire. The explosion also damaged a nearby railway bridge, which was used to transport goods and people.

The exact circumstances surrounding the explosion are still unclear, but it is believed that the explosion was caused by a deliberate act of sabotage. Ukrainian officials have denied any involvement in the explosion, while Russian officials have pointed the finger at Ukraine.

#Immediate Impact

The immediate impact of the explosion was significant. The bridge was closed to traffic, and all rail traffic was suspended. The explosion also caused significant disruptions to Russian military operations in Ukraine, as the bridge was a critical supply route for Russian forces.

In the aftermath of the explosion, Russian authorities launched a major investigation into the incident. The investigation, which was led by the Russian Federal Security Service (FSB), was tasked with determining the cause of the explosion and identifying those responsible.

#Structural Damage to the Bridges

The explosion caused significant structural damage to the Crimean Bridge. The bridge's roadway was severely damaged, and several sections of the bridge were destroyed. The nearby railway bridge was also damaged, although the extent of the damage is still unclear.

In the days following the explosion, Russian authorities worked to assess the damage to the bridge and to develop a plan to repair it. The repairs, which were expected to take several months to complete, were seen as a major priority for Russian authorities.

#Reaction

##Ukrainian

Ukrainian officials denied any involvement in the explosion, with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy stating that Ukraine was not responsible for the incident. Ukrainian officials also pointed out that the explosion was a clear example of the risks associated with Russia's continued occupation of Crimea.

##Russian

Russian officials were quick to point the finger at Ukraine, with Russian President Vladimir Putin stating that the explosion was a "terrorist attack" carried out by Ukraine. Russian officials also vowed to take action against those responsible for the explosion.

##International

The international community was quick to condemn the explosion, with many countries calling for a thorough investigation into the incident. The United States, the European Union, and other countries issued statements expressing concern about the explosion and its implications for regional stability.

#Aftermath

##Effect on Russian Forces

The explosion had a significant impact on Russian military operations in Ukraine. The bridge was a critical supply route for Russian forces, and its closure caused significant disruptions to Russian military operations. Russian forces were forced to rely on alternative supply routes, which were seen as more vulnerable to attack.

##Effect on Russian Government

The explosion also had a significant impact on the Russian government. The incident was seen as a major embarrassment for Russian authorities, who had touted the Crimean Bridge as a symbol of Russia's strength and resilience. The incident also raised questions about the security of Russian infrastructure and the ability of Russian authorities to protect critical assets.

#Investigation

The investigation into the explosion was led by the Russian Federal Security Service (FSB). The investigation, which was launched in the aftermath of the explosion, was tasked with determining the cause of the explosion and identifying those responsible.

In the days following the explosion, Russian authorities announced that they had identified several suspects in connection with the incident. The suspects, who were reportedly Ukrainian nationals, were accused of carrying out the explosion on behalf of the Ukrainian government.

article:
Irene Mawer

Irene Mawer was a British artist and educator known for her contributions to the development of modern art education in the United Kingdom. Throughout her career, Mawer worked tirelessly to promote the value of art education, and her influence can still be seen in the many artists and educators she inspired.

#Early life and education

Irene Mawer was born in 1881 in London, England. She grew up in a family that valued art and education, and she was encouraged from a young age to pursue her creative interests. Mawer's early education took place at the St. John's Wood School of Art, where she developed her skills as a painter and printmaker.

##Artistic training

Mawer's artistic training continued at the Royal College of Art, where she studied from 1901 to 1905. During her time at the Royal College, Mawer was exposed to a wide range of artistic styles and techniques, and she began to develop her own unique approach to art.

#Career

Irene Mawer's career as an artist and educator spanned many decades. She worked as a teacher at several schools and colleges, including the Royal College of Art and the Central School of Arts and Crafts.

##Teaching philosophy

Mawer's teaching philosophy emphasized the importance of creativity and experimentation in the artistic process. She believed that students should be encouraged to explore a wide range of techniques and media, and that they should be given the freedom to develop their own unique style.

##Artistic practice

In addition to her work as a teacher, Mawer was also a practicing artist. She worked in a variety of media, including painting, printmaking, and textiles. Mawer's artwork is characterized by its use of bold colors and geometric forms, and it reflects her interest in modern art movements such as Cubism and Futurism.

#Influence and legacy

Irene Mawer's influence on modern art education in the United Kingdom cannot be overstated. She was one of the first women to teach at the Royal College of Art, and she paved the way for future generations of female artists and educators.

##Impact on art education

Mawer's teaching philosophy and practice had a profound impact on the development of art education in the United Kingdom. Her emphasis on creativity and experimentation helped to shape the way that art was taught in schools and colleges, and her influence can still be seen in the many artists and educators she inspired.

##Recognition and awards

Mawer's contributions to art education were recognized during her lifetime. She was awarded the Royal College of Art's Silver Medal in 1905, and she was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society of Arts in 1920.

#Personal life

Irene Mawer never married and devoted her life to her career as an artist and educator. She lived in London for most of her life, and she was known for her love of travel and her interest in modern art and culture.

##Relationships and friendships

Mawer was known for her close relationships with her students and colleagues. She was a mentor and a friend to many young artists, and she played an important role in their development as artists.

#Alumni and associates

article:
2023 Karnataka Legislative Assembly election

The 2023 Karnataka Legislative Assembly election was a state election that took place in Karnataka, India, to elect members to the Karnataka Legislative Assembly. The election was held in a single phase on May 10, 2023. The results were declared on May 13, 2023.

Background

The Karnataka Legislative Assembly election of 2023 was the 16th legislative assembly election in the state. The previous election was held in 2018, in which the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) formed the government with B.S. Yediyurappa as the Chief Minister. However, Yediyurappa resigned in 2021, and Basavaraj Bommai took over as the Chief Minister.

Political developments

Defections before polls

In the run-up to the election, there were several defections from the Indian National Congress (INC) and the Janata Dal (Secular) (JDS) to the BJP. The most notable defection was that of S.T. Somashekhar, a senior INC leader, who joined the BJP in March 2023. Several other INC and JDS legislators also defected to the BJP, citing dissatisfaction with their respective parties.

Schedule

The Election Commission of India (ECI) announced the schedule for the election on March 29, 2023. The election was held on May 10, 2023, and the results were declared on May 13, 2023. The ECI also announced that the model code of conduct would come into effect from March 29, 2023.

Election statistics

Electorate

The total electorate in Karnataka was approximately 5.21 crore (52.1 million), with 2.61 crore (26.1 million) male voters and 2.60 crore (26 million) female voters.

Polling stations

The ECI set up a total of 58,282 polling stations across the state, with an average of 900 voters per polling station.

Parties contesting

Several parties contested the election, including the BJP, INC, JDS, and others.

Bharatiya Janata Party

The BJP contested the election under the leadership of Basavaraj Bommai, the incumbent Chief Minister. The party promised to continue its development agenda and to provide corruption-free governance.

Indian National Congress

The INC contested the election under the leadership of D.K. Shivakumar, the state party president. The party promised to provide a corruption-free government and to address the issues of unemployment and poverty.

Janata Dal (Secular)

The JDS contested the election under the leadership of H.D. Kumaraswamy, the former Chief Minister. The party promised to provide a stable government and to address the issues of farmers and rural development.

Others

Several other parties, including the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), the Communist Party of India (Marxist) (CPI-M), and the Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP), also contested the election.

Candidates

A total of 2,922 candidates contested the election, with an average of 7 candidates per constituency.

Issues

Several issues dominated the election campaign, including the Belagavi border dispute, corruption, communal polarization, reservation controversy, farm laws, and Nandini vs Amul.

Belagavi border dispute

The Belagavi border dispute between Karnataka and Maharashtra was a major issue during the election campaign. The BJP and the INC promised to resolve the issue in favor of Karnataka.

Corruption

Corruption was a major issue during the election campaign, with all parties promising to provide corruption-free governance.

Communal polarization

Communal polarization was a significant issue during the election campaign, with the BJP and the INC accusing each other of communalizing the election.

Reservation controversy

The reservation controversy was another major issue during the election campaign, with the BJP and the INC promising to address the issue of reservation for backward classes.

Farm laws

The farm laws were a major issue during the election campaign, with the INC and the JDS promising to repeal the laws and to provide support to farmers.

Nandini vs Amul

The Nandini vs Amul controversy was another issue during the election campaign, with the BJP and the INC promising to support the local dairy cooperative, Nandini.

Controversies

Several controversies marred the election campaign, including remarks on 'Love jihad', provocative statements by Amit Shah, collection and sale of voter data, and conspiracy to assassinate Kharge.

Remarks on 'Love jihad'

The BJP's remarks on 'Love jihad' sparked controversy during the election campaign, with the INC and the JDS accusing the party of communalizing the election.

Provocative statements by Amit Shah

Amit Shah's provocative statements during the election campaign sparked controversy, with the INC and the JDS accusing him of communalizing the election.

Supreme Court remarks on his speeches

The Supreme Court's remarks on Amit Shah's speeches sparked controversy, with the court observing that his speeches were inflammatory and communally charged.

Collection and sale of voter data

The collection and sale of voter data sparked controversy during the election campaign, with the INC and the JDS accusing the BJP of misusing voter data.

Kharge remark on PM Modi

Kharge's remark on PM Modi sparked controversy during the election campaign, with the BJP accusing him of making a personal attack on the Prime Minister.

Congress manifesto promise to ban Bajrang Dal

The INC's promise to ban the Bajrang Dal in its manifesto sparked controversy, with the BJP accusing the party of communalizing the election.

Conspiracy to assassinate Kharge

The conspiracy to assassinate Kharge sparked controversy during the election campaign, with the INC accusing the BJP of plotting to kill its leader.

Questions on fairness of Election Commission

The fairness of the Election Commission was questioned during the election campaign, with the INC and the JDS accusing the commission of being biased towards the BJP.

Sonia Gandhi speech

Sonia Gandhi's speech during the election campaign sparked controversy, with the BJP accusing her of making a personal attack on PM Modi.

Campaigns

The election campaign was marked by several campaigns by the parties, including the BJP, INC, and JDS.

Bharatiya Janata Party

Manifesto

The BJP released its manifesto on April 28, 2023, promising to continue its development agenda and to provide corruption-free governance.

Indian National Congress

Manifesto

The INC released its manifesto on April 25, 2023, promising to provide a corruption-free government and to address the issues of unemployment and poverty.

Janata Dal (Secular)

Manifesto

The JDS released its manifesto on April 22, 2023, promising to provide a stable government and to address the issues of farmers and rural development.

Surveys

Several opinion polls and exit polls were conducted during the election campaign, predicting a close contest between the BJP and the INC.

Opinion polls

Several opinion polls were conducted during the election campaign, predicting a close contest between the BJP and the INC. A survey by the India Today Group predicted that the BJP would win 102 seats, while the INC would win 95 seats.

Exit polls

Several exit polls were conducted during the election campaign, predicting a close contest between the BJP and the INC. A survey by the CNN-News18 predicted that the BJP would win 104 seats, while the INC would win 93 seats.

Results

The results of the election were declared on May 13, 2023. The INC won 136 seats, while the BJP won 66 seats. The JDS won 19 seats, while others won 9 seats.

Vote share

The INC secured 42.88% of the vote share, while the BJP secured 36.00%. The JDS secured 12.31% of the vote share.

Seat share

The INC won 136 seats, while the BJP won 66 seats. The JDS won 19 seats, while others won 9 seats.

Result by party

The INC won 136 seats, while the BJP won 66 seats. The JDS won 19 seats, while others won 9 seats.

Results by district

The INC performed well in several districts, including Bengaluru Urban, Bengaluru Rural, and Mysuru. The BJP performed well in several districts, including Belagavi, Dharwad, and Haveri.

Results by constituency

The INC won several constituencies, including Bengaluru South, Bengaluru North, and Mysuru. The BJP won several constituencies, including Belagavi, Dharwad, and Haveri.

Aftermath

The election expenditure was a major issue after the election, with several candidates and parties accused of exceeding the expenditure limit.

Election expenditure

The election expenditure was a major issue after the election, with several candidates and parties accused of exceeding the expenditure limit. The ECI ordered an inquiry into the matter.

article:
The Last of Us (TV series)

The Last of Us is a post-apocalyptic drama television series based on the 2013 video game of the same name by Naughty Dog. The series premiered on January 15, 2023, on HBO and has received widespread critical acclaim for its storytelling, characters, and faithfulness to the original game.

#Cast and characters

##Main

The main cast includes:

* Pedro Pascal as Joel, a hardened survivor tasked with escorting Ellie across the United States.
* Bella Ramsey as Ellie, a young girl who is immune to the deadly Cordyceps virus that has devastated humanity.
* Gabriel Luna as Tommy, Joel's younger brother and a member of a settlement in Jackson, Wyoming.
* Merle Dandridge as Marlene, the leader of the resistance group known as the Fireflies.
* Nico Parker as Sarah, Joel's daughter who dies in the early stages of the outbreak.

##Guest

The series features several guest stars, including:

* Murray Bartlett as Frank, a survivor who forms a relationship with Bill.
* Nick Offerman as Bill, a survivalist who helps Joel and Ellie on their journey.
* Melanie Lynskey as Kathleen, the leader of a group of rebels in Kansas City.
* Lamar Johnson as Henry, a young man who becomes embroiled in a conflict with the rebels.

##Season 2

In April 2023, it was announced that the series had been renewed for a second season. The main cast is expected to return, with new characters and cast members to be announced.

#Episodes

##Season 1 (2023)

The first season consists of nine episodes, which premiered on January 15, 2023.

1. "When You're Lost in the Darkness" - The series premiere introduces Joel and Ellie as they begin their journey across the United States.
2. "Infected" - Joel and Ellie encounter a group of infected humans in Boston.
3. "Long, Long Time" - Bill and Frank's backstory is explored in this episode.
4. "Please Hold My Hand" - Joel and Ellie meet Henry and Sam in Kansas City.
5. "Endure and Survive" - Kathleen's backstory is explored, and Joel and Ellie face off against the rebels.
6. "Kin" - Joel and Ellie reach Tommy's settlement in Jackson, Wyoming.
7. "Left Behind" - Ellie's backstory is explored in this episode, which takes place before the events of the series.
8. "When We Are in Need" - Joel and Ellie face a group of hostile survivors in the mountains.
9. "Look for the Light" - The season finale sees Joel and Ellie reach the Fireflies' base, where they face a difficult decision.

##Season 2

The second season is currently in production, with no release date announced. The season is expected to be based on the video game's sequel, The Last of Us Part II.

#Production

##Development

The series was first announced in March 2020, with Craig Mazin and Neil Druckmann set as the showrunners. Mazin is a longtime fan of the video game series and had previously worked on the HBO series Chernobyl. Druckmann is the creative director of Naughty Dog and was heavily involved in the development of the video game.

##Casting

The casting process for the series was extensive, with Pedro Pascal and Bella Ramsey announced as the leads in February 2021. The rest of the main cast was announced over the following months.

##Writing

The writing team for the series includes Mazin, Druckmann, and several other writers. The team worked closely with Naughty Dog to ensure that the series remained faithful to the original game.

##Filming

Filming for the series took place in Alberta, Canada, from July 2021 to June 2022. The production team built several sets, including a replica of the video game's post-apocalyptic world.

##Music

The score for the series was composed by Gustavo Santaolalla, who also composed the music for the video game. The soundtrack features a mix of electronic and orchestral elements.

##Design and post-production

The series' visual effects were handled by several companies, including Weta Digital and Iloura. The production team also worked closely with Naughty Dog to ensure that the series' characters and environments were faithful to the original game.

#Release

##Broadcast and home media

The series premiered on January 15, 2023, on HBO in the United States. It is also available to stream on HBO Max. The series has been released in several other countries, including the United Kingdom, Canada, and Australia.

##Promotion

The series was heavily promoted by HBO, with several trailers and teasers released in the months leading up to its premiere. The network also partnered with Naughty Dog to promote the series, including a special event at the 2022 Comic-Con International.

#Reception

##Critical response

The series has received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising its storytelling, characters, and faithfulness to the original game. The series holds a 96% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with several critics praising its emotional depth and strong performances.

##Ratings

The series premiered to strong ratings, with its first episode drawing 4.7 million viewers in the United States. The series has consistently drawn high ratings throughout its run, with its season finale drawing 8.2 million viewers.

##Awards and nominations

The series has been nominated for several awards, including several Primetime Emmy Awards. It won several awards at the 2023 Visual Effects Society Awards, including Outstanding Visual Effects in a Photoreal Episode.

#Notes

* The series is the first live-action adaptation of the video game series.
* The series' success has led to a renewed interest in the video game series, with sales of the game increasing significantly following the series' premiere.

#References

* This article does not include any citations or references.

2021 Men's Rugby League World Cup

The 2021 Men's Rugby League World Cup was the 16th edition of the Rugby League World Cup, a quadrennial international rugby league tournament contested by the top national teams. The tournament was originally scheduled to take place in 2021, but due to the COVID-19 pandemic, it was postponed to 2022. The tournament was held in England from October 15 to November 19, 2022.

# Teams

## Qualification

The qualification process for the 2021 Men's Rugby League World Cup began in 2018. The top three teams from the 2017 Rugby League World Cup, Australia, England, and New Zealand, automatically qualified for the tournament. The remaining 13 teams qualified through a series of regional and international competitions, including the European Championship, the Americas Championship, and the Pacific Qualifiers.

## Draw

The draw for the 2021 Men's Rugby League World Cup took place on January 16, 2020, in Buckingham Palace, London. The 16 teams were divided into four groups of four teams each. The groups were:

Group A: England, Samoa, France, Greece
Group B: Australia, Fiji, Scotland, Italy
Group C: New Zealand, Lebanon, Jamaica, Ireland
Group D: Tonga, Papua New Guinea, Wales, Cook Islands

## Squads

Each team was allowed to name a squad of 24 players for the tournament. The squads were announced in the months leading up to the tournament.

## On-field rules and disciplinary measures

The 2021 Men's Rugby League World Cup followed the standard international rugby league rules. The tournament also featured a number of disciplinary measures, including sin-binning and sending-off.

# Warm-up matches

The 2021 Men's Rugby League World Cup featured a number of warm-up matches in the weeks leading up to the tournament. The matches were:

1. England vs. Fiji - October 8, 2022

article:
Pinoy Big Brother: Kumunity Season 10
=====================================

Pinoy Big Brother: Kumunity Season 10 is the tenth main season of the Philippine reality television series Pinoy Big Brother, which premiered on October 16, 2021, on Kapamilya Channel, Kapamilya Online Live, and A2Z. The show is hosted by Toni Gonzaga, Bianca Gonzalez, Robi Domingo, and Kim Chiu.

Development
------------

### Auditions

Auditions for the season were held from June to July 2021 through online submission and in-person auditions in various locations in the Philippines. Aspiring housemates were required to submit a three-minute video showcasing their personality, interests, and motivation for joining the show.

### COVID-19

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the show's production team implemented strict health and safety protocols to ensure the well-being of the housemates and staff. Housemates were required to undergo quarantine and testing before entering the Big Brother House.

### Timeslot

The show initially aired on weeknights at 10:30 PM, with weekend episodes airing at 9:00 PM. However, due to the show's popularity, the timeslot was later moved to 8:30 PM on weeknights.

Overview
--------

### Logo

The season's logo features a stylized letter "K" made up of puzzle pieces, symbolizing the show's theme of community and unity.

### House

The Big Brother House is located in Eugenio Lopez Drive, Quezon City. The house features a modern and minimalist design, with a total of 14 bedrooms, 2 kitchens, and 5 bathrooms.

### Hosts

The season is hosted by Toni Gonzaga, Bianca Gonzalez, Robi Domingo, and Kim Chiu. Gonzaga and Gonzalez serve as the main hosts, while Domingo and Chiu host the show's online content and special segments.

### Theme songs

The season's theme song is "Kumunity" by Bamboo, which is used in the show's opening and closing credits.

### Prizes

The grand prize for the season is ₱2 million, which will be awarded to the Big Winner. Other prizes include a brand-new house and lot, and a business package.

Format
-------

### Twists

The season features several twists, including the introduction of new housemates, surprise evictions, and game-changing challenges.

Housemates
------------

The season started with 16 housemates, including 8 celebrities, 4 adults, and 4 teens. The housemates come from different walks of life and have varying personalities, interests, and motivations for joining the show.

Episodes
---------

The season consists of 100 episodes, which will air from October 16, 2021, to February 24, 2022.

Houseguests
------------

### Celebrities

The celebrity housemates include Alex Gonzaga, Anji Salvacion, Brenda Mage, Eian Rances, Karen Bordador, Madam Inutz, Shawntel Nicholson, and TJ Valderrama.

### Teens

The teen housemates include Ashton Salvador, Ella Cayabyab, Gabb Skribikin, and Kobie Brown.

### Biga-10

The Biga-10 is a group of 10 housemates who entered the house on Day 50. They include Alyssa Valdez, Andi Abaya, Chie Filomeno, Criza Taa, Dustine Mayores, Jaye Salazar, Maxine Trinidad, Michael Ver, Samantha Bernardo, and Seham Daghlas.

### Houseplayers

The houseplayers are a group of 5 housemates who entered the house on Day 70. They include DJ Loonyo, EJ Laure, Kyzha Villalino, Marky Miranda, and Rain Matienzo.

Tasks
------

### Weekly tasks

The housemates participate in weekly tasks, which are designed to test their skills, teamwork, and strategy. The tasks are usually related to the show's theme and may involve challenges, games, and puzzles.

### Other tasks

The housemates also participate in other tasks, such as household chores, cooking, and cleaning.

Challenges
------------

### Head of Household

The Head of Household (HOH) is a weekly challenge that determines which housemate will become the HOH for the week. The HOH wins immunity from nomination and gets to nominate two housemates for eviction.

### Ligtask

The Ligtask is a weekly challenge that determines which housemate will win a luxury item or privilege.

### Group challenges

The group challenges are team-based challenges that require the housemates to work together to achieve a common goal.

### Kumuni-Test

The Kumuni-Test is a weekly challenge that tests the housemates' knowledge, skills, and strategy. The challenge may involve puzzles, games, and quizzes.

Nomination history
------------------

### Celebrities

The celebrity housemates have nominated each other for eviction throughout the season. The nominations are usually based on personal reasons, conflicts, and strategies.

#### Powers

Some celebrity housemates have won powers that allow them to save or nominate other housemates.

### Adults

The adult housemates have also nominated each other for eviction throughout the season.

#### Special nomination process

The adult housemates have participated in a special nomination process, which involves a random draw to determine which housemate will be nominated for eviction.

### Teens

The teen housemates have nominated each other for eviction throughout the season.

### Biga-10

The Biga-10 housemates have nominated each other for eviction since their entry into the house.

### S-E voting system results

The S-E voting system results are used to determine which housemate will be saved or evicted.

Big Night
----------

### Results

The Big Night is the season's finale, which will air on February 24, 2022. The results of the season's winner will be announced during the Big Night.

Big Homecoming
----------------

The Big Homecoming is a special episode that will air after the season's finale. The episode will feature the housemates' return to their homes and families.

Reception
----------

### Praise

The season has received praise for its engaging storyline, relatable housemates, and exciting challenges.

### Controversy

The season has also been involved in controversy, including allegations of favoritism and unequal treatment of housemates.

References
----------

article:
Penny Mordaunt

Penelope Mary Mordaunt is a British politician who has served as Leader of the House of Commons and Lord President of the Council since 2022. She has been the Member of Parliament (MP) for Portsmouth North since 2010 and has held various ministerial positions, including Secretary of State for International Development, Minister for Women and Equalities, and Secretary of State for Defence.

#Early life and education

Penny Mordaunt was born on March 4, 1973, in Torquay, Devon, England. Her father, John Mordaunt, was a parachute regiment officer, and her mother, Jennifer Mordaunt, was a former special needs teacher. Mordaunt has two siblings, a brother, and a sister. She was educated at Oaklands Catholic School in Waterlooville, Hampshire, and later attended the University of Reading, where she studied philosophy.

#Early professional career

Before entering politics, Mordaunt worked in various roles, including as a magician's assistant, a marketing consultant, and a hospital administrator. In 2000, she joined the Conservative Party's parliamentary research unit, where she worked on policy development and research. In 2003, she became a special adviser to the Shadow Secretary of State for Education, Tim Collins.

#Entry into parliament

Mordaunt was selected as the Conservative Party's candidate for Portsmouth North in 2010. She won the seat with a majority of 7,289 votes, becoming the first Conservative MP to represent the constituency since 1997. In her maiden speech, she highlighted the need for greater investment in the Royal Navy and the importance of preserving the UK's maritime heritage.

#Ministerial career

##Secretary of State for International Development: 2017–2019

In November 2017, Mordaunt was appointed Secretary of State for International Development, succeeding Priti Patel. As Secretary of State, she was responsible for overseeing the UK's aid budget and developing the government's international development policy. During her tenure, she focused on improving the effectiveness and transparency of UK aid, as well as promoting British values and interests abroad.

##Minister for Women and Equalities: 2018–2019

In April 2018, Mordaunt was appointed Minister for Women and Equalities, a role which she held concurrently with her position as Secretary of State for International Development. As Minister, she was responsible for promoting equality and addressing issues affecting women, including domestic violence, pay inequality, and representation in the workforce.

##Secretary of State for Defence: 2019

In May 2019, Mordaunt was appointed Secretary of State for Defence, becoming the first woman to hold the position. As Secretary of State, she was responsible for overseeing the UK's armed forces and developing the government's defence policy. Her tenure was marked by a focus on modernizing the armed forces and improving the welfare of service personnel.

##Re-entry into Government

After losing her position as Secretary of State for Defence in July 2019, Mordaunt returned to the backbenches. However, in 2020, she was appointed as the UK's Paymaster General, a role which she held until 2022.

##Leader of the House of Commons: 2022–2024

In September 2022, Mordaunt was appointed Leader of the House of Commons and Lord President of the Council, succeeding Jacob Rees-Mogg. As Leader of the House, she is responsible for overseeing the business of the House of Commons and promoting the government's legislative agenda.

#Conservative leadership bids

##July–September 2022

In July 2022, Mordaunt announced her candidacy for the Conservative Party leadership, following the resignation of Prime Minister Boris Johnson. She ran on a platform of promoting social justice, improving public services, and strengthening the economy. However, she was eliminated from the contest in the final round, losing to Liz Truss.

##October 2022

Following the resignation of Prime Minister Liz Truss, Mordaunt announced her candidacy for the Conservative Party leadership for a second time. However, she withdrew from the contest before the final round, paving the way for Rishi Sunak to become Prime Minister.

#Military service

Mordaunt is a Royal Navy reservist and has served on several deployments, including a tour of duty in Afghanistan. She has been awarded the Naval General Service Medal and the Operational Service Medal for her service.

#Views and activities

##Splash! appearance

In 2014, Mordaunt appeared on the ITV reality TV show Splash!, where she competed in a diving competition. She was eliminated in the first round but raised over £7,000 for charity.

##Brexit

Mordaunt was a strong supporter of the UK's withdrawal from the European Union, commonly known as Brexit. She served on the Leave campaign's board during the 2016 EU referendum and has since advocated for a "soft Brexit" that preserves the UK's economic and security ties with the EU.

##Northern Ireland

Mordaunt has been a strong supporter of the Union and has advocated for greater investment in Northern Ireland. She has also called for greater cooperation between the UK and Ireland to address issues affecting the region, including the legacy of the Troubles.

##Homeopathy

Mordaunt has been a vocal critic of homeopathy, describing it as "witchcraft" and calling for greater regulation of alternative therapies.

##Muslim Council of Britain meeting

In 2018, Mordaunt faced criticism for meeting with the Muslim Council of Britain, an organization that has been accused of promoting Islamist extremism. She defended the meeting, stating that she was seeking to engage with Muslim communities and promote social cohesion.

##Royal yachts

Mordaunt has been a strong supporter of the Royal Yacht Britannia, which was decommissioned in 1997. She has called for the construction of a new royal yacht to promote British trade and diplomacy abroad.

##Vandalism of war memorials

Mordaunt has been a vocal critic of vandalism and desecration of war memorials, describing such acts as "sickening" and "disrespectful". She has called for greater protection of war memorials and increased penalties for those who vandalize them.

#Personal life

Mordaunt is married to Ian Lyon, a former naval officer. The couple has no children. She is a keen sailor and has completed several long-distance sailing trips, including a solo voyage across the Atlantic.

#Decorations

* Naval General Service Medal
* Operational Service Medal

#Publications

* "Greater: Britain after the storm" (2019)

#References

title: Municipal_history_of_Quebec
article:
**Municipal History of Quebec**

The municipal history of Quebec spans over four centuries, from the early colonial period to the present day. The province has undergone numerous changes in its municipal structure, governance, and administration, shaped by its unique cultural, social, and economic contexts. This article provides a comprehensive overview of the major developments and milestones in Quebec's municipal history.

**1599 to 1793**

##1599
In 1599, Samuel de Champlain, the French explorer, founded the first permanent settlement in Quebec, which would eventually become the city of Quebec. This marked the beginning of European colonization in the region.

##1608
Champlain established the Habitation de Québec, a fortified settlement that served as the administrative center of New France. The settlement was governed by a council of advisors, which laid the foundation for future municipal governance.

##1634
The French Crown granted the Company of One Hundred Associates, a trading company, control over New France, including the governance of Quebec. This marked the beginning of a more formalized administrative system.

##1642
The French Crown established the Office of the Intendant, which was responsible for the administration of justice, finance, and municipal affairs in Quebec. The Intendant played a crucial role in shaping the province's municipal structure.

##1793
The British government passed the Constitutional Act, which divided the Province of Quebec into two separate provinces: Upper Canada (now Ontario) and Lower Canada (now Quebec). This marked the beginning of a new era in Quebec's municipal history.

**19th century**

##1802
The British government established the first municipal councils in Quebec, with the creation of the Quebec Municipal Council. This council was responsible for governing the city of Quebec and its surrounding areas.

##1832
The British government passed the Act of the British Parliament, which granted municipal autonomy to the city of Quebec and other urban centers in the province. This marked a significant step towards self-governance for Quebec's municipalities.

##1841
The British government passed the Act of Union, which united the provinces of Upper and Lower Canada into a single entity, the Province of Canada. This led to the creation of a new municipal system, with the establishment of district councils and municipal boards.

##1845
The Province of Canada passed the Municipal Institutions Act, which established a standardized system of municipal governance across the province. This act created the office of the mayor and council, and defined the powers and responsibilities of municipal governments.

##1846
The city of Quebec was granted a charter, which gave it greater autonomy and self-governance. This marked an important milestone in the development of Quebec's municipal system.

##1847
The Province of Canada passed the Municipal Tariff Act, which granted municipalities the power to raise revenue through taxation. This marked a significant step towards financial autonomy for Quebec's municipalities.

##1848
The Province of Canada passed the Municipal Corporations Act, which established a framework for the incorporation of municipalities and the creation of municipal corporations.

##1849
The city of Montreal was granted a charter, which gave it greater autonomy and self-governance. This marked an important milestone in the development of Quebec's municipal system.

##1850
The Province of Canada passed the Municipalities Act, which established a standardized system of municipal governance across the province. This act created the office of the warden and council, and defined the powers and responsibilities of municipal governments.

##1852
The Province of Canada passed the Municipal Roads Act, which granted municipalities the power to build and maintain roads. This marked a significant step towards infrastructure development in Quebec.

##1853

Kalki 2898 AD
================

Kalki 2898 AD is an upcoming Indian science fiction film written and directed by Nag Ashwin. The film is set in a post-apocalyptic world and is based on the Hindu mythology of Kalki, the tenth avatar of Lord Vishnu. The movie is produced by C. Ashwini Dutt and Priyanka Dutt under the banner of Vyjayanthi Movies.

Plot
-----

The film is set in the year 2898 AD, in a world that has been devastated by a catastrophic event. The story follows the journey of a young boy named Kalki, who is believed to be the reincarnation of Lord Vishnu. Kalki is on a mission to save humanity from the clutches of evil forces that have taken over the world. Along the way, he meets a group of survivors who join him on his quest.

As they journey through the treacherous terrain, they encounter various obstacles and challenges. They also discover that the catastrophic event that destroyed the world was not a natural disaster, but a man-made catastrophe caused by human greed and ambition. Kalki and his team must fight against the evil forces to restore peace and order to the world.

Cast
-----

The film features a talented ensemble cast, including:

* Nithiin as Kalki, the protagonist of the film
* Rashmika Mandanna as Maya, a strong-willed and determined young woman who joins Kalki on his quest
* Priyanka Arul Mohan as Dr. Sophia, a scientist who helps Kalki understand the true nature of the catastrophic event
* Srikanth as Arjun, a skilled warrior who becomes Kalki's ally
* Thalaivasal Vijay as Guruji, a wise and powerful mentor who guides Kalki on his journey

### Cameo appearances

The film also features cameo appearances by several notable actors, including:

* R. Sarathkumar as Lord Vishnu
* Nassar as a wise old sage
* Prabhu as a powerful king

Production
------------

### Development

The idea for Kalki 2898 AD was conceived by Nag Ashwin, who was fascinated by the Hindu mythology of Kalki. He spent several years researching and developing the script, drawing inspiration from various sources, including the Mahabharata and the Puranas.

### Pre-production

Pre-production on the film began in 2019, with the team working on the storyboards, character designs, and visual effects. The film's budget was estimated to be around ₹100 crore, making it one of the most expensive Telugu films ever made.

### Casting

Casting for the film began in 2020, with Nithiin being the first actor to be cast as Kalki. Rashmika Mandanna and Priyanka Arul Mohan were later cast as the female leads, while Srikanth and Thalaivasal Vijay were cast in supporting roles.

### Filming

Principal photography on the film began in February 2020 and lasted for several months. The film was shot on location in various places, including Hyderabad, Chennai, and Dubai. The team used advanced technology, including drone cameras and 3D printing, to create the film's elaborate sets and visual effects.

### Post-production

Post-production on the film began in 2022, with the team working on the editing, visual effects, and sound design. The film's music was composed by Mickey J. Meyer, who had previously worked with Nag Ashwin on the film Mahanati.

Music
------

The film's music was composed by Mickey J. Meyer, who had previously worked with Nag Ashwin on the film Mahanati. The soundtrack features several songs, including the hit single "Kalki Theme", which was released in 2022.

Marketing
----------

The film's marketing campaign began in 2022, with the team releasing several teasers and trailers. The film's posters and promotional materials were designed by the team at Vyjayanthi Movies, who had previously worked on several successful films.

Release
-------

### Theatrical

The film is scheduled to release in theaters on December 22, 2023. The film will be released in Telugu, Tamil, and Hindi, and will be distributed by Vyjayanthi Movies.

### Film festivals

The film is also expected to be screened at several film festivals, including the Cannes Film Festival and the Toronto International Film Festival.

### Distribution

The film will be distributed by Vyjayanthi Movies, who have previously distributed several successful films.

The film's pre-release business has been strong, with the team selling the film's rights to several distributors for a record price.

### Home media

The film will be released on home media platforms, including DVD and streaming services, after its theatrical release.

### Box office

The film is expected to perform well at the box office, with several analysts predicting that it will be one of the highest-grossing Telugu films of all time.

### Critical response

The film has received positive reviews from critics, with several praising its visuals, action sequences, and performances.

-------

The film's success is expected to lead to a franchise, with the team planning to make several sequels and spin-offs.
